info.title: Zenith Payments Developer Guide
info.description: OpenAPI specification generated from Postman collection: Zenith Payments Developer Guide

tags.name: How to get started?
tags.description:
There will be five stages in your integration

1. Discuss your requirements with our payments specialists
    
2. Apply for a sandbox account
    
3. Development
    
4. Demo
    
5. Production Sign Off
    

To get started, talk to us about your particular business and technology requirements. Our team of Payment Specialists will ensure you have access to the right solutions that meet your needs.

They will also assist you with your application for a sandbox account and API credentials.

# Contact Us

- Please email us at [integrations@zenithpayments.com.au](https://integrations@zenithpayments.com.au)
    

# Getting your API credentials

Your Sandbox API credentials for Merchant APIs will consist of a username, a password and a API-Key.  
For Customer APIs, the bearer token is self-generated from the customer portal.

We are able to provide you with you're very own Sandbox API credentials after our initial requirements meeting with our payment specialists.

You are able to use your sandbox details with the "Run in Postman" link above. Remember to set your desired language in the examples.

# Sandbox URLs

The below is a list of the different Sandbox environments where you are able to develop, test and experiment using the different ZenPay APIs.

| **Sandbox Environment** | **Link** |
| --- | --- |
| TravelPay | [https://api.sandbox.travelpay.com.au](https://apiuat.travelpay.com.au) |
| TravelPay B2B | [https://api](https://apiuat.travelpay.com.au)[.sandbox](https://apiuat.travelpay.com.au)[.travelpay.com.au](https://apiuat.travelpay.com.au) |
| School Easy Pay | [https://api](https://apiuat.schooleasypay.com.au)[.sandbox](https://apiuat.travelpay.com.au)[.schooleasypay.com.au](https://apiuat.schooleasypay.com.au) |
| Childcare Easy Pay | [https://api](https://apiuat.childcareeasypay.com.au)[.sandbox](https://apiuat.travelpay.com.au)[.childcareeasypay.com.au](https://apiuat.childcareeasypay.com.au) |
| Thoroughbred Payments | [https://api](https://apiuat.thoroughbredpayments.com.au)[.sandbox](https://apiuat.travelpay.com.au)[.thoroughbredpayments.com.au](https://apiuat.thoroughbredpayments.com.au) |
| Rental Rewards | [https://api](https://apiuat.rentalrewards.com.au)[.sandbox](https://apiuat.travelpay.com.au)[.rentalrewards.com.au](https://apiuat.rentalrewards.com.au) |
| B2BPay | [https://api](https://apiuat.b2bpay.com.au)[.sandbox](https://apiuat.travelpay.com.au)[.b2bpay.com.au](https://apiuat.b2bpay.com.au) |

# Production / Live URLs

Once you have completed the process of development and testing, we will run a quick sign off meeting with you. Allowing you to demonstrate your software and the integrations between the two systems, and allowing us to understand the integrations that you have developed.

Once both parties have signed off we can then proceed to provide live credentials and URLs for production.

Please reach out to your Account Manager to schedule the integration sign off.

tags.name: PCI Compliance
tags.description:
Every organization that handles card payments must comply with the Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard (PCI DSS). Annual compliance is mandated by the payment card schemes and banks.

## What is PCI DSS?

PCI DSS is a global standard, helping to protect cardholder data and tackle the growing threat of security breaches. It sets the operational and technical requirements for organizations handling card payments, and for software developers and manufacturers of payment applications and devices.

Zenith Payment's entire infrastructure is fully compliant with PCI DSS - we are certified at Level 1, which is the highest level of compliance. We are independently audited annually for compliance by qualified security assessors.

## What this means for you?

Whilst Zenith Payments is a PCI DSS compliant organisation, if your organization does accept card payments then it must also be fully compliant. Non-compliance with PCI DSS could make you responsible for any losses through fraud, and you may also face considerable fines from the card schemes and banks.

There are four levels of compliance, dependant on how many transactions are processed by your organisation in a year. Find out how your organisation can reach compliance at the [PCI Security Standards Council Website](https://www.pcisecuritystandards.org/pci_security/maintaining_payment_security)

tags.name: jQuery Payment Plugin
tags.description:
The ZenPay JQuery plugin allows you to easily make payments or tokenize cards/bank accounts utilising a user-friendly, easy to use UI that is built within the browser. The plugin can be used as an iframe form or can displayed on the webpage in a place of your choosing by embedding the iframe to your webpage.

**jQuery Version 5 is now available in both our Sandbox and Production environments:**

> **â—Please note that after 30 September 2025, plugins on V4 and below will no longer be able to process payments or tokenise cards.** 
  

- If you are currently using jQuery plugin V4, then the main change is to upgrade your hashing from SHA512 to SHA3-512 and update your URL from v4 to v5.  
    Additionally, there are new optional input parameters available to enable you to customise the display of â€˜Customer Nameâ€™, â€˜Customer Referenceâ€™, and â€˜Payment Amountâ€™ labels.
    
- If you are on V3 please see the migration guide.
    
- If you are currently using jQuery plugin V1, V2, we recommend scheduling a session in with our integrations team to talk through the specific upgrade requirements.
    

**Apple Pay**

The jQuery Plugin solution now supports Apple Pay. If you are interested in adding this feature as a payment method, you need to pass the Apple Pay parameter â€œallowApplePayOneOffPaymentâ€ and set as â€œTrueâ€. You then need to engage with the Zenith Integrations team to verify your domain.

**Google Pay**

The jQuery Plugin solution now supports Google Pay. If you are interested in adding this feature as a payment method, you need to pass the Google Pay parameter â€œallowGooglePayOneOffPaymentâ€ and set as â€œTrueâ€.

tags.name: jQuery Payment Plugin > Overview
tags.description:
## Use Cases

There are a variety of use cases in which the JQuery plugin can be used in your integration, the below examples are some of the most common use cases where the JQuery plugin works well.

### Shopping Cart

The JQuery plugin can be used in a shopping cart type of system, through which a customer can add items to their shopping cart and upon checkout of their cart they are able to use the JQuery plugin to make a payment for their purchase. The plugin works great here as it takes very minimal space on the site and expands when the user clicks on the button.

### One-Off Payment

The JQuery plugin can be used as a one-off payment solution, whereby a customer is able to easily complete a one-off payment to a merchant using the plugin. The customers payment is able to be traced by using a payment reference in a simple, easy way of your choice.

### Card Tokenization

The JQuery plugin is able to tokenize customer cards and bank accounts, by creating a unique token for the payment method instead of storing the actual card/bank account details in the system, the token is generated and stored securely to uniquely identify the payment method the customer has tokenized. Customers can feel more secure and protected knowing that their card and bank details are kept safe and not stored in the system.

tags.name: jQuery Payment Plugin > JQuery V3 to V5 Migration Guide
tags.description:
# ZenPay Migration Guide: Version 3 to Version 5

This guide explains how to migrate your ZenPay integration from v3 to v5, focusing on key changes in hashing, required parameters, and payload structure.

If you are on an earlier version (v1 or v2), please reach out to our integrations team for assistance by emailing [integrations@zenithpayments.com.au](https://mailto:integrations@zenithpayments.com.au).

> ðŸ’¡ Please note this example uses travelpay as the program domain. In your own code, use the program domain that's relevant to you 
  

- b2bpay
    
- childcareeasypay
    
- schooleasypay
    
- thoroughbredpayments
    
- travelpay
    
- rentalrewards
    

---

## 1\. Plugin Assets

- **jQuery:** Ensure jQuery v3.7.1 is loaded before ZenPay JS:
    

``` html
<script src="<https://code.jquery.com/jquery-3.7.1.min.js>"></script>

 ```

- **ZenPay JS (Only use one):**
    

``` html
Bootstrap v5 (Recommended):
<comment class='preserveHtml' class='preserveHtml' class='preserveHtml' class='preserveHtml' class='preserveHtml' class='preserveHtml' class='preserveHtml' class='preserveHtml' class='preserveHtml' class='preserveHtml' class='preserveHtml' class='preserveHtml' class='preserveHtml' class='preserveHtml' class='preserveHtml' class='preserveHtml' class='preserveHtml'> For Bootstrap 5 please use following            -->
<script src="<https://cdn.travelpay.com.au/js/zenpay.payment.bs5.js>"></script>
Bootstrap v3 (Not Recommended):
<comment class='preserveHtml' class='preserveHtml' class='preserveHtml' class='preserveHtml' class='preserveHtml' class='preserveHtml' class='preserveHtml' class='preserveHtml' class='preserveHtml' class='preserveHtml' class='preserveHtml' class='preserveHtml' class='preserveHtml' class='preserveHtml' class='preserveHtml' class='preserveHtml' class='preserveHtml'> For Bootstrap 3, please use following            -->
<script src="<https://cdn.travelpay.com.au/js/zenpay.payment.js>"></script>

 ```

- **ZenPay CSS:**
    

``` html
<link rel="stylesheet" href="<https://cdn.travelpay.com.au/css/zenpay.payment.css>">

 ```

---

## Official Demo, Documentation, and Full Configuration Reference

- **Official v5 Demo & Docs:** [https://pay.sandbox.travelpay.com.au/demo/](https://pay.sandbox.travelpay.com.au/demo/)
    

This page contains:

- Error codes table
    
- Input and output parameter tables
    
- All available configuration options and usage notes
    
- Live demo and code sample
    

---

## 2\. Endpoint URL Update

- **v3:**
    

``` plaintext
url: "<https://payuat.travelpay.com.au/online/v3>"

 ```

- **v5:**
    

``` plaintext
url: "<https://pay.sandbox.travelpay.com.au/online/v5>"

 ```

Update your integration to use the v5 endpoint.

Production URL remains the same, changing to /v5 (travel pay used as an example below)

``` plaintext
url: "<https://pay.travelpay.com.au/online/v5>"

 ```

---

## 3\. Fingerprint Hash Algorithm

- **v3:** Used SHA1 for fingerprint generation.
    

``` javascript
// v3 (SHA1)
const hash = SHA1(apiKey|userName|password|mode|paymentAmount|merchantUniquePaymentId)

 ```

**v5:** Uses SHA3-512 for stronger security.

``` javascript
// v5 (SHA3-512, note the new timestamp field)
const hash = SHA3512(apiKey|userName|password|mode|paymentAmount|merchantUniquePaymentId|timestamp)

 ```

---

## 4\. New and Changed Required Parameters

| Parameter | v3 | v4 | v5 (required) |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| merchantCode | No | No | Yes |
| customerEmail | No | Yes | Yes |
| timestamp | No | No | Yes |

**Details:**

- `merchantCode`: Now required in both the payload and endpoint URL.
    
- `customerEmail`: Added in v4, required in v5.
    
- `timestamp`: New in v5, must be included in both the fingerprint and payload.
    
    - Format: `'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS'` (UTC ISO-8601).
        

> **â—Please note that if you or your merchants are expecting payment success confirmation emails, you must now explicitly pass** sendConfirmationEmailToMerchant **as true when calling the plugin to continue receiving these emails after the v5 migration.** 
  

---

## 5\. Example Migration: Before and After

> **â—Please note that these examples are for demonstration purposes only. In production, always use a secure backend to generate fingerprints and handle sensitive data.** 
  
> ðŸ›¡ï¸ **Important**:  
Always use the exact same values for all fingerprint parameters (apiKey, merchantCode, mode, paymentAmount, merchantUniquePaymentId, and especially **timestamp**) in both fingerprint payload and the ZenPay plugin payload.  
Even a 1-second difference in timestamp will cause a fingerprint mismatch and throw an error during initialization (e.g., error **E08**). 
  

## v1 & v2:

If you are on older versions of the plugin, please review the example below, or reach out to our integration team with any questions by emailing [integrations@zenithpayments.com.au ](https://mailto:integrations@zenithpayments.com.au) for assistance.

## v3 Example:

``` javascript
// Create payload for fingerprint
const apiKey = "PUBLIC_API_KEY";  // Provided by Zenith Payments
const userName = "username";      // Provided by Zenith Payments
const password = "password";      // Provided by Zenith Payments
const mode = 0;                   // Mode 0: Static Payment - Mode 1: Tokenization - Mode 2: Dynamic Payment - Mode 3: Pre-auth
const paymentAmount = 250.00;     // Tip: always use two decimal digits (e.g., 250.00)
const merchantUniquePaymentId = crypto.randomUUID(); // Could be anything as long as unique
// Generate fingerprint using SHA1
const fpPayload = `${apiKey}|${userName}|${password}|${mode}|${paymentAmount * 100}|${merchantUniquePaymentId}`;
const fingerprint = CryptoJS.SHA1(fpPayload).toString(); 
// Create payload for ZenPay plugin
const zpPayload = {
  url: "https://payuat.travelpay.com.au/online/v3",
  apiKey,                         // Must match value used in fingerprint generation
  fingerprint,                    // SHA1 fingerprint
  redirectUrl: "https://payuat.travelpay.com.au/demo?result",
  mode,                           // Must match value used in fingerprint generation
  customerName: "Jane Doe",
  customerReference: "INV-991",
  merchantUniquePaymentId,        // Must match value used in fingerprint generation
    paymentAmount // Must match value used in fingerprint generation, but as dollars (e.g., if hash used 1234 then paymentAmount is 12.34)
};
// Initialize ZenPay plugin
const payment = $.zpPayment({ ...zpPayload });
const result = payment.open();    // Use open() for v3

 ```

---

## v5 Example:

``` javascript
// Create payload for fingerprint
const apiKey = "PUBLIC_API_KEY";            // Provided by Zenith Payments
const userName = "username";                // Provided by Zenith Payments
const password = "password";                // Provided by Zenith Payments
const merchantCode = "TPDEMOMERCH";         // Provided by Zenith Payments - Required in v5
const mode = 0;                             // Mode 0: Static Payment - Mode 1: Tokenization - Mode 2: Dynamic Payment - Mode 3: Pre-auth
const paymentAmount = 250.00;               // Tip: always use two decimal digits (e.g., 250.00)
const merchantUniquePaymentId = crypto.randomUUID(); // Could be anything as long as unique
const timestamp = new Date().toISOString().slice(0, 19); // Format: 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS'
// Generate fingerprint using SHA3-512
const fpPayload = `${apiKey}|${userName}|${password}|${mode}|${paymentAmount * 100}|${merchantUniquePaymentId}|${timestamp}`;
const fingerprint = sha3_512(fpPayload); 
// Create payload for ZenPay plugin
const zpPayload = {
  url: "https://pay.sandbox.travelpay.com.au/online/v5",
  apiKey,                         // Must match value used in fingerprint generation
  fingerprint,                    // SHA3-512 fingerprint
  merchantCode,                   // Provided by Zenith Payments - Required in v5
  redirectUrl: "https://pay.sandbox.travelpay.com.au/demo?result",
  mode,                           // Must match value used in fingerprint generation
  customerName: "Jane Doe",
  customerReference: "INV-991",
  merchantUniquePaymentId,        // Must match value used in fingerprint generation
  paymentAmount,                  // Must match value used in fingerprint generation, but as dollars (e.g., if hash used 1234 then paymentAmount is 12.34)
  timestamp,                      // Must match value used in fingerprint generation
  customerEmail: "jane.doe@example.com"
};
// Initialize ZenPay plugin
const payment = $.zpPayment({ ...zpPayload });
const result = payment.init();    // Use init() for v5

 ```

---

## 6\. One-Time IDs

- **`merchantUniquePaymentId`** must be unique for every payment request.
    
- Once used, it cannot be reused, regardless of payment status.
    

---

## 7\. Summary Table: Key Migration Changes

| Change | v3 | v5 (required) |
| --- | --- | --- |
| Hash Algorithm | SHA1 | SHA3-512 |
| Fingerprint Fields | No timestamp | Includes `timestamp` |
| merchantCode | Not required | Required |
| customerEmail | Not required | Required (since v4) |
| timestamp | Not required | Required |

---

## 8\. Best Practices

- **Never** generate fingerprints or handle backend secrets client-side.
    
- Always generate the fingerprint and unique payment ID on your backend.
    
- Validate all required fields before initializing the plugin.

- There will be no change to your API keys as part of this migration
    
- Please prepare your development cycle around this date, as we will no longer support the current UAT environment from the above stated date.

tags.name: jQuery Payment Plugin > Apple Pay
tags.description:
The jQuery Plugin solution now supports Apple Pay. To set it up, the Zenith Payments team can guide you through the integration process consisting of a few simple steps.

## Integration Process

To accept Apple Pay payments using the jQuery plugin, you need to follow a few simple steps:

1. The integrator or merchant needs to contact the Zenith Payments Integrations Team with the specific domain URL that they would like to integrate with Apple Pay (e.g., [www.b2bpay.com.au](http://www.b2bpay.com.au))
    
2. Zenith Payments will register the provided domain with Apple Pay. (This is a crucial step to ensure the security and proper functioning of the integration).
    
3. After the domain is registered, Zenith Payments will provide a file for each domain/merchant. This file is essential for the integration process.
    
4. The integrator/merchant must place the provided file in a specific path on their website, ensuring it is publicly accessible. This step is essential for Apple Pay to verify the integration.
    
5. Once the file is in place, reach out to the team at Zenith Payments and the team will verify the integration with Apple Pay.
    
6. After successful verification, the integration is complete and Apple Pay is ready for use on the website using the jQuery payment plugin.

tags.name: jQuery Payment Plugin > Test Cards
tags.description:
**Please note that these cards are for Sandbox only.** Card expiry date is required to be set to a date in the future, name and CVV field values can be sample values for testing purposes. Please check the program that you are building in for the test card numbers. If you want to test JCB or Latitude pay cards, please contact the integration team who can facilitate this for you. ## **B2BPay, Childcare EasyPay, Rental Rewards, Throughbred Payments, and TravelPay** ##### General Errors | **Card Type** | **Test Card Number** | **Transaction Status** | | --- | --- | --- | | American Express | 3782 8224631 0005 | Success | | Visa | 4111 1111 1111 1111 | Success | | Visa | 4242 4242 4242 4242 | Failure | | Mastercard | 5555 5555 5555 4444 | Success | | Mastercard | 5105 1051 0510 5100 | Failure | | Union Pay | 6250 9460 0000 0016 | Success | | Union Pay | 6250 9470 0000 0014 | Failure | - Please note that there is no 3DS for tokenization in Sandbox, you can use the failure cards above with a total amount of 65.00 to simulate a failure. This will return the error **Failed: 2003 - The transaction was declined (Test decline) (2003)**. Please ensure that the total amount, including pricing, equals **exactly** $65.00 ##### 3DS Simulation | Card Type | Test Card Number | Result | | --- | --- | --- | | Visa | 4000 0010 0000 0000 | Frictionless - Fully Authenticated | | Visa | 4111 1111 1111 1111 | Frictionless - Fully Authenticated | | Mastercard | 5555 5555 5555 4444 | Frictionless - Fully Authenticated | | Visa | 4000 0020 0000 0008 | Frictionless - Fully Authenticated | | Visa | 4000 0010 0000 0216 | Frictionless - Attempted | | Visa | 4000 0020 0000 0016 | Frictionless - Attempted | | Visa | 4000 0010 0000 0109 | Challenge | | Mastercard | 5000 0010 0000 0007 | Challenge | | Visa | 4000 0020 0000 0024 | Challenge | | Visa | 4000 0010 0000 0307 | Not Authenticated | | Visa | 4000 0020 0000 0032 | Not Authenticated | | Visa | 4000 0010 0000 0208 | Rejected | | Visa | 4000 0020 0000 0040 | Rejected | | Visa | 4000 0030 0000 0006 | Error: Not Enrolled | | Visa | 4000 0030 0000 0014 | Error: Network Timeout | | Visa | 4000 0030 0000 0022 | Error: Network Error | | Visa | 4000 0030 0000 0030 | Error: Invalid card | | Visa | 4000 0040 0000 0004 | Error: Access Denied | | Visa | 4000 0040 0000 0012 | Error: Transient System Error | | Visa | 4000 0040 0000 0020 | Error: Invalid Format | | Visa | 4000 0040 0000 0038 | Error: Network Timeout | | Visa | 4000 0040 0000 0046 | Error: Network Error | | Visa | 4000 0040 0000 0053 | Error: Configuration missing | | Visa | 4000 0040 0000 0061 | Error: Configuration incomplete | ## School Easy Pay | **Card Type** | Test Card Number | **Result** | | --- | --- | --- | | Mastercard

tags.name: PayID > Overview
tags.description:
PayID is a faster payment method for bank account payments. Customers can make PayID payments from within their bank account application or online banking portal by using a unique PayID identifier. Customers then enter the PayID (which is an email address) and a PayID description to make a payment to the merchant. PayID is a great alternative to EFT as merchants gain extra security by not having to provide their BSB and Bank Account details. #### Benefits to Merchants - Quick and easy new way to pay. - Instant approval with no subsequent failures. - Secure â€“ no need to give out bank details (like with EFT) which prevent frauds and unauthorised debits - Cleared Funds in your bank account by lunchtime the next banking day. - Always the correct reference regardless of what the customer enters \*with â€˜Customerâ€™ PayID Type\* - Fast â€“ easy to use, real time payment processing. - Easy â€“ Customer pays via their existing bank APP / website. - Visible â€“ payments immediately appear in the payment history. - Always On â€“ operates 24/7 365. #### Benefits to Customers - Easy â€“ pay through your existing Bank App/website - No cost to you - Merchant knows you have paid immediately - Merchant gets your transaction funds quickly - Secure, modern, payment method Zenith Payments supports three different types of PayID levels. More details about each of the different PayID types can be found below. **Summary of PayID Types** | | **Program PayID** | **Customer PayID** | **Merchant PayID** | | --- | --- | --- | --- | | **PayID Type**



**Example:**
| Every merchant in the program has the same PayID email address.

pay@travelpay.com.au
| Every customer in the program has a unique PayID email address.

john_12345678@travelpay.com.au | Every merchant in the program has a different PayID email address.

@travelpay.com.au
| | **Suitable For** | Most merchants wanting to quickly implement PayID. | Ongoing payments when customers may be inclined to enter the wrong reference when they pay. | One-off transactions / invoice payments
| | **Customer profile and CML Required?
(Customer-Merchant Link)**
| Yes | Yes | No | | **PayID Description the customer needs to enter** | PayID Description the customer needs to enter | The customer can enter whatever reference they like. | Reference that was provided by the merchant on the invoice, etc.
| | **Customer Reference used in reports (Reconciliation, etc.)** | The Customer Reference that is stored in the Customerâ€™s profile for that merchant.
| The Customer Reference that is stored in the Customerâ€™s profile for that merchant. | 'Description/Messageâ€™ field the Customer enters in their Bank App/Site when paying | | **Additional Reference
used in reports**
| â€˜Description/Messageâ€™ field the Customer enters in their Bank App/Site when paying | â€˜Description/Messageâ€™ field the Customer enters in their Bank App/Site when paying | â€˜Referenceâ€™ field the Customer enters in their Bank App/Site when paying | | **Advantages
** | Easy to implement.

| The merchant always receives the stored Customer Reference even if the customer enters the wrong reference when paying. | Easy to use â€“ customer pays just like they would with EFT.

Easy to implement â€“ merchant just adds their PayID to their invoice template. | ## Merchant Level Merchant Level PayID provides the merchant with a unique PayID email address that they can put on their invoices or send to customers so that their customers can use to make a payment to that merchant. #### Use Cases - One-off transactions - Ad hoc Invoice payments #### How it Works? - PayID email address specifies the merchant in ZenPay. (i.e. (merchantcode)@b2bpay.com.au) - Does not require a customer profile to work (No CML is required) - The PayID reference is generated upon creation and is provided by the merchant - Customer enters in the correct reference as specified by the merchant to assist the merchant with reconciliation) #### How does a Merchant create a PayID Email Address? For this type of integration, PayID is created by the Zenith Support staff for the requested merchant/s. #### How does a customer make a PayID payment? The user makes a payment from their banking app via their mobile device or PC. User enters the PayID email, in return the banking app will display the PayID name for the merchant. The user enters description and message (reference) which are captured and attached to payment. "CustomerReference" and "AdditionalReference" parameters are used for capturing this information. More information coming soon... ## Customer Level Coming Soon... ## Program Level Coming Soon...

tags.name: API Overview
tags.description:
Welcome to ZenPay's REST API for online payment services.

Our REST API enables you to integrate your business software with ZenPay's payment processing and management solutions. Adhering to a RESTful architecture it gives you a fast, flexible and scalable integration solution.

## What's available?

### Merchant API

| Endpoint | Description |
| --- | --- |
| Batch Payments | Manage Batch Payments. You can create or fetch batch payments. |
| Card Proxies (Tokenization) | Manage card proxies. Please note that this POST endpoint is locked behind a setting and can only be accessed after it's been enabled by Zenith Payments. |
| Customers | Manage customers |
| Payments | Manage Payments. You can create or fetch one-off payments. |
| Request Pays | Manage request to pays.You can create or fetch request pays. |
| Diagnostics | System Diagnostics |

### Customer API

| Endpoint | Description |
| --- | --- |
| Payments | Manage Payments. You can create or fetch one-off payments. |
| Diagnostics | System Diagnostics |

tags.name: API Overview > Error Codes
tags.description:
ZenPay uses standard HTTP response codes to indicate the success or failure of an API request.

In general "status codes" in the `2XX` range indicate success.

Whereas, "status codes" in the `4XX` range indicate a client-side error, which means that there was a failure in the information provided (e.g., a missing parameter, unauthorized access etc.).

"Status codes" in the `5XX` range indicate an error with Zenith Payment's internal servers (Which happens very rarely).

If the response code is not `2XX`, it means the operation failed somehow and you may  
need to take action accordingly. You can check the response (which will be in JSON format)  
for a field called **`message`** which briefly explains the error reported.

| Status Code | **Error** | Explanation |
| --- | --- | --- |
| 400 | Bad Request | The request was unacceptable, often due to missing a required parameter. |
| 401 | Unauthorized | No valid API key provided. |
| 402 | Request Failure | The request has failed, however the variables were valid. |
| 403 | Forbidden | The API key does not have the the right permissions to perform the request. |
| 404 | Not Found | The requested resource doesn't exist. |
| 429 | Too Many Requests | The API request limit is exceeded. Please see section Rate Limiting for more info. |
| 5XX | Server Error | ZenPay servers have failed to process your request. (Rare, however you can contact support anytime). |

tags.name: Webhooks and Callbacks
tags.description:
Zenith Payments provides outbound notifications so that integrators can be informed of payment results.

There are two technical delivery mechanisms:

- **Webhooks** â€“ Merchant-wide notifications configured once by Zenith. These are event-based: whenever a transaction belonging to the merchant changes status (across any channel or payment method), Zenith fires a webhook. They are dispatched on a scheduler/timer that evaluates transaction states and posts updates.
    
- **Callbacks(jQuery Only)** â€“ Transaction-specific notifications only available in the **jQuery Payment Plugin**. If the integrator includes a `callbackUrl` in the plugin payload, Zenith posts the transaction result to that URL after processing.
    

**Key differences**

| Aspect | Webhooks | Callbacks (jQuery plugin only) |
| --- | --- | --- |
| Scope | Merchant-wide (all transactions) | Single transaction (initiated by plugin) |
| Trigger | Any payment status change | Immediately when upstream processing completes (response received) |
| Configuration | Set up once by Zenith on merchant acct | Passed as `callbackUrl` in plugin payload |
| Delivery | Event-based, timer-driven POST | Asynchronous POST after processing |
| Availability | All channels / methods | jQuery plugin only, not APIs |

> Use **Webhooks** for backend reconciliation and settlement tracking.  
Use **Callbacks** if you need immediate, per-transaction acknowledgement when using the plugin. 
  

# Webhooks

Webhooks are merchant-wide, event-based notifications configured at the merchant account level by Zenith.

Once a webhook endpoint is registered, Zenith will POST JSON payloads whenever the status of any transaction for that merchant changes. This includes all payment methods.

**Requirements and Characteristics**

- **Merchant-wide** â€“ Any transaction initiated under the merchant account is eligible.
    
- **Event-based** â€“ Fired when transaction status changes (e.g. from Pending to Successful).
    
- **Timer-driven** â€“ A scheduled job evaluates transactions and dispatches events.
    
- **Channel-agnostic** â€“ All payment methods trigger the same webhook mechanism.
    
- **Stable HTTPS POST endpoint** â€“ Must be reachable from Zenith's servers.
    

### Webhook Payload Fields

| Field | Type | Notes |
| --- | --- | --- |
| `Version` | number | Payload version number. |
| `Event` | string | Event type (e.g. `New`, `Update`). |
| `PayloadType` | string | Type of payload delivered (e.g. `Payment, Customer`). |
| `PaymentReference` | string | Unique payment reference assigned by Zenith. |
| `CustomerName` | string | null |
| `CustomerReference` | string | Reference provided by the merchant. |
| `PaymentStatus` | number | Numeric status code. |
| `PaymentStatusDisplay` | string | Human-readable payment status. |
| `BaseAmount` | number | Base amount before fees. |
| `FundsToMerchant` | number | Net amount payable to the merchant. |
| `CustomerFee` | number | Fee charged to the customer. |
| `MerchantFee` | number | Fee charged to the merchant. |
| `PaymentAmount` | number | Total amount of the transaction. |
| `AccountOrCardNo` | string | Masked account or card number. |
| `PaymentMethod` | number | Numeric code for the payment method. |
| `PaymentMethodDisplay` | string | Human-readable payment method. |
| `PaymentCardType` | number | Numeric code for the card type. |
| `PaymentCardTypeDisplay` | string | Human-readable card type. |
| `SubCardType` | string | null |
| `SubtCardTypeDisplay` | string | null (Field name is misspelled, this is not an error in documentation) |
| `ProcessingDateTime` | string | UTC ISO-8601 datetime (`yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ss`). |
| `SettlementDate` | string | UTC ISO-8601 date (`yyyy-MM-dd`). |
| `ProcessorReference` | string | Reference from the processor/gateway. |
| `IsPaymentSettledToMerchant` | boolean | Indicates if the payment has been settled. |
| `MerchantUniquePaymentId` | string | null |
| `MerchantCode` | string | Merchant identifier. |
| `AdditionalReference` | string | null |
| `PaymentSource` | number | Numeric source identifier. |
| `PaymentSourceDispaly` | string | Field name is misspelled, this is not an error in documentation |
| `IsPaymentRecalled` | boolean | Indicates if the payment has been recalled. |
| `IsPaymentRefunded` | boolean | Indicates if the payment has been refunded. |

## **Webhook Payload Example**

``` json
{
  "Version": 1,
  "Event": "New",
  "PayloadType": "Payment",
  "Payload": {
    "PaymentReference": "210768",
    "CustomerName": null,
    "CustomerReference": "1",
    "PaymentStatus": 3,
    "PaymentStatusDisplay": "Successful",
    "BaseAmount": 155.08,
    "FundsToMerchant": 155.08,
    "CustomerFee": 4,
    "MerchantFee": 0,
    "PaymentAmount": 159.08,
    "AccountOrCardNo": "411111XXXXXX1111",
    "PaymentMethod": 0,
    "PaymentMethodDisplay": "Credit / Debit Card",
    "PaymentCardType": 1,
    "PaymentCardTypeDisplay": "Visa - International Cards",
    "SubCardType": null,
    "SubtCardTypeDisplay": null,
    "ProcessingDateTime": "2025-08-27T22:08:14",
    "SettlementDate": "2025-08-28",
    "ProcessorReference": "2a41cff0e84ee15f8b42",
    "IsPaymentSettledToMerchant": false,
    "MerchantUniquePaymentId": null,
    "MerchantCode": "1337",
    "AdditionalReference": null,
    "PaymentSource": 39,
    "PaymentSourceDispaly": "Api Tokenised Payment",
    "IsPaymentRecalled": false,
    "IsPaymentRefunded": false
  }
}

 ```

# Callbacks (jQuery Plugin Only)

Callbacks are only supported in the **jQuery Payment Plugin** and are not available in the REST API.

When a `callbackUrl` parameter is included in the plugin payload, Zenith will POST the transaction result to that URL after the payment is processed.

**Requirements and Characteristics**

- **Transaction-specific** â€“ The callback applies only to the transaction in which the `callbackUrl` was supplied.
    
- **Asynchronous** â€“ Delivery occurs in the background after Zenith finishes processing, not as a browser redirect.
    
- **Integrator-controlled** â€“ The integrator decides the callback destination via the `callbackUrl` option.
    
- **Not merchant-wide** â€“ Callbacks do not notify on other transactions; for that, use webhooks.
    
- **HTTPS POST endpoint** â€“ Must expose a secure endpoint that is reachable from Zenith.
    
- **Asynchronous handling** â€“ Must accept POSTs that may arrive seconds after the browser flow completes.
    
- **Validation** â€“ Should validate the `validationCode` (SHA3-512) for integrity before trusting the payload.
    

## Callback Payload Fields

| Field | Type | Notes |
| --- | --- | --- |
| `paymentReference` | string | Unique payment reference assigned by Zenith. |
| `customerName` | string | Name of the customer. |
| `customerReference` | string | Reference provided by the merchant. |
| `paymentStatus` | number | Numeric status code of the payment. |
| `paymentStatusString` | string | Human-readable payment status (e.g. â€œSuccessfulâ€). |
| `baseAmount` | number | Base transaction amount before fees. |
| `fundsToMerchant` | number | Net amount payable to the merchant. |
| `accountOrCardNo` | string | Masked account or card number. |
| `paymentAccount` | string | Payment account type (e.g. `Card`, `Bank`). |
| `processingDate` | string | UTC ISO-8601 datetime (`yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ss[.fff]`). |
| `settlementDate` | string | UTC ISO-8601 datetime (`yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ss`). |
| `processorReference` | string | Reference from the processor/gateway. |
| `isPaymentSettledToMerchant` | boolean | Indicates if the payment has been settled to the merchant. |
| `failureCode` | string | Failure code if unsuccessful, otherwise empty. |
| `failureReason` | string | Failure reason if unsuccessful, otherwise empty. |
| `paymentCard` | string | Card brand (e.g. MasterCard, Visa). |
| `merchantUniquePaymentId` | string | Unique ID supplied by the merchant for the payment. |
| `merchantCode` | string | Merchant identifier code. |
| `transactionSource` | number | Numeric identifier for the source channel. |
| `transactionSourceString` | string | Human-readable source channel (e.g. plugin or API). |
| `customerFee` | number | Fee charged to the customer. |
| `processedAmount` | number | Total processed amount including fees. |
| `cardCategory` | string | Category of the card (e.g. Domestic, International). |
| `cardInformationSaved` | boolean | Indicates whether the card information was stored for tokenisation. |
| `validationCode` | string | SHA3-512 hash for payload integrity validation. |

## **Callback Payload Example**

``` json
{
  "response": {
    "paymentReference": "95408",
    "customerName": "Leah Adria",
    "customerReference": "a12b1926-811f-411c-b10a-1b330cc50d3b",
    "paymentStatus": 3,
    "paymentStatusString": "Successful",
    "baseAmount": 635.72,
    "fundsToMerchant": 635.72,
    "accountOrCardNo": "555555XXXXXX4444",
    "paymentAccount": "Card",
    "processingDate": "2025-08-27T21:48:59.447",
    "settlementDate": "2025-08-29T00:00:00",
    "processorReference": "ddb3a3436cbc7d77c241",
    "isPaymentSettledToMerchant": false,
    "failureCode": "",
    "failureReason": "",
    "paymentCard": "MasterCard",
    "merchantUniquePaymentId": "35917c6c-ee6b-4e52-866b-bea51841e796",
    "merchantCode": "1337",
    "transactionSource": 36,
    "transactionSourceString": "Public_Customer_OnlineOneOffPayment",
    "customerFee": 63.57,
    "processedAmount": 699.29,
    "cardCategory": "International Cards",
    "cardInformationSaved": false
  },
  "validationCode": "1dbe5ddcc72b8207e839da42308d0596cbbb72e5bf7074520ec885e3c615bb519848fce4a0c073a9a7e6544854338cab9c0c87bc8c82c54bb3706a91c21a7410"
}

 ```

tags.name: Merchant APIs
tags.description:
## Zenith Payments Merchant APIs

The ZenPay merchant APIs allow merchants to complete a variety of tasks via API including managing batch payments, creating and managing card proxies, managing customers, managing payments, managing request to pays (RTP) and running diagnostics.

tags.name: Merchant APIs > Authentication
tags.description: ## Basic Authentication [Basic authentication](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Basic_access_authentication) is a simple authentication scheme built into the HTTP protocol. The client sends HTTP requests with the `Authorization` header that contains the word `Basic` followed by a space and a base64-encoded string `username:password`. ZenPay Merchant APIs utilize basic authentication alongside with API-Key for access. Please contact our integration team from [integrations@zenithpayments.com.au](https://mailto:integrations@zenithpayments.com.au) to request access for Merchant APIs. ## Adding a Username/Password and API-Key to the Postman Collection In the Postman client, click on the three dots to the right of the collection name to "View more actions." Then, click "Edit.", Click on the "Variables" tab and, fill in the required rows; \* baseURL \* Username \* Password \* API-Key # Notes \* Please note that variables are case sensitive.

tags.name: Merchant APIs > BatchPayments
tags.description:
#### POST: Process Batch Payment

This endpoint allows merchants to upload and process a batch of payments in a single request by providing a collection of payment entries in JSON format. It returns a response confirming the batch payment creation or any errors encountered.

- **Note**: Ensure the batch payment details are correct to avoid errors or duplicate entries.
    

#### GET: Fetch Batch Payment Summary

This endpoint retrieves a summary of a specific batch payment identified by `batchPaymentID`. The summary includes details such as the batch payment status, processing date, and the number of transactions within the batch.

- **Parameters**: `batchPaymentID` (integer, required) - Unique identifier for the batch payment.
    

#### GET: Fetch Batch Payment Transactions

This endpoint returns the list of all transactions associated with a specific batch payment identified by `batchPaymentID`. Use this endpoint to get detailed information about each transaction in the batch, including amounts, statuses, and more.

- **Parameters**: `batchPaymentID` (integer, required) - Unique identifier for the batch payment.

tags.name: Merchant APIs > CardProxies
tags.description:
#### POST: Create Card Proxy

This endpoint generates a card proxy (a tokenized representation of card details) to securely process payments. This method is suitable for applications that require secure card tokenization.

- **Note**: Not recommended for software or websites that do not meet a certain level of PCI DSS compliance. For a more secure card tokenization and payment option, refer to our **jQuery Payment Plugin**.
    

#### GET: Fetch Card Proxy Details

This endpoint retrieves details of a specific card proxy identified by `cardProxy`. It returns token response details and can be used to verify or manage tokenized cards.

- **Parameters**: `cardProxy` (string, required) - The card proxy identifier for which details are needed.
    

#### DELETE: Delete Card Proxy

This endpoint permanently deletes a card proxy from the system. It does not affect any customer who registered using this proxy but ensures that the proxy is no longer valid for future transactions.

- **Parameters**: `cardProxy` (string, required) - The card proxy to delete.
    

#### GET: Fetch Card Proxy Pricing

This endpoint calculates and retrieves pricing details for a card proxy based on a given payment amount. It is useful for determining transaction fees before processing a payment.

- **Parameters**:
    
    - `cardProxy` (string, required) - The card proxy identifier.
        
    - `paymentAmount` (double, required) - The amount for which pricing is to be calculated.

tags.name: Merchant APIs > Customers
tags.description:
This API allows you to manage customers.

You can create customers, fetch customer details and also update customer details.

tags.name: Merchant APIs > Payments
tags.description:
# **POST: Create Payment**

- This endpoint allows merchants to initiate a new payment transaction by providing customer details, payment amounts, and other necessary information. It supports both tokenized and direct card payments.
    
    ## **Note:** Direct card payments require PCI DSS compliance and are enabled only for specific merchants.
    

# **GET: Transaction Information**

- These endpoints allow merchants to retrieve detailed information about an existing transaction, including its status, processing date, settlement details, and more. You can query transactions by various identifiers to get real-time information on their processing status.

tags.name: Merchant APIs > RequestPays
tags.description:
This API allows you to manage request pays.

Using this API you can create new request pay or fetch existing details of request pays.

tags.name: Merchant APIs > Pre-Auth
tags.description:
Pre-Authorization allows merchants to authorize a customers card and reserve funds for future transactions without charging the card in the moment.

# GET: Capture PreAuth Card

This endpoint allows merchants to capture an amount from a created Pre-Auth. This requires the preauthReference generated from the POST: Create Preauth endpoint.

# POST: Create PreAuth

This endpoint allows merchants to initiate a new Pre-Auth by providing customer details, payment amounts and other necessary information. It supports both tokenized and direct card payments.  
Note: Direct card payments reuqire PCI DSS compliance and are enabled only for specific merchants.

# GET: Check PreAuth via preauthReference  
GET: Check PreAuth via CustomerReference

These endpoints allow merchants to retrieve detailed information about an existing transaction, including its status, processing date and more.

# PUT: Void PreAuth Request

This endpoint allows for the preauth to be voided or cancelled, not allowing any further payments to be put against the initial value.

tags.name: Merchant APIs > Diagnostics
tags.description:
This API allows you to ping ZenPay internal servers.

Using this API you are able to troubleshoot connection issues and check the ZenPay server status.

tags.name: Customer APIs
tags.description:
## Zenith Payments Customer APIs

The ZenPay customer APIs allow customers to complete a variety of tasks via API including managing authentication, managing payments and running diagnostics.

tags.name: Customer APIs > Authentication
tags.description:
## Bearer Authentication

Bearer authentication (also called token authentication) is an [HTTP authentication scheme](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Authentication) that involves security tokens called bearer tokens.

ZenPay Customer APIs utilize bearer authentication for access. To generate a bearer token from ZenPay, please log into the customer portal and generate a token under your profile.

## Generating an Access Token

Log into the customer portal.

Navigate to Profile > Generate Token

## Adding an Access Token to the Postman Collection

In the Postman client, click on the three dots to the right of the collection name to "View more actions."

Then, click "Edit", Click on the "Variables" tab and, fill in the required rows;

*   baseURL
*   customerCode
*   bearerToken
    

![](https://schooleasypay.com.au/wp-content/uploads/2022/05/Variables.png)

# Notes

*   Please note that variables are case sensitive.

tags.name: Customer APIs > Diagnostics
tags.description: Start here to test your credentials.

post.description:
Generate a card proxy.

Not recommended for software / sites that are not PCI DSS compliant. For a easy and secure card tokenisation and payment option, see our Payment Plugin jQuery.

This endpoint is locked behind a setting and can only be utilized once it has been enabled by Zenith Payments.

delete.description: Delete card proxy permanently from the system. This will not affect any customer, registered using this proxy.

parameters.description: (Required) Payment amount to determine the pricing

get.summary: Fetch all Customers based on the filters

parameters.name: customerReference
parameters.description: Customer reference

parameters.name: customerStatuses
parameters.description: Customer statuses. Default is all. 0 - Open, 1 - AwaitingEmailVerfication, 2 - AwaitingSignature, 3 - SetUpIncomplete, 4 - Restricted, 5 - Closed, 6 - OnHold

parameters.name: fromOpenDate
parameters.description: From Customer open date. Format: yyyy-MM-dd

parameters.name: toOpenDate
parameters.description: To Customer open date. Format: yyyy-MM-dd

parameters.name: fromClosedDate
parameters.description: From Customer closed date. Format: yyyy-MM-dd

parameters.name: toClosedDate
parameters.description: To Customer closed date. Format: yyyy-MM-dd

parameters.name: paymentOptions
parameters.description: Payment options. Default is all. 22 - AutoPay, 23 - EmailReminder, 24 - SmsReminder, 25 - FixedTerm, 26 - BatchPay, 27 - ScheduledPay, 28 - OneOff, 148 - PayID, 149 - BPAY

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Starting index of the record. An index starts from 0. Default = 0

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Page size. Default = 20. Maximum page size allowed = 2000

List of all customers.

It will display all customers regardless of customerStatus. It will include closed customers as well.

put.description:
StartFragment

Customer Bank/Credit Card account. Use PaymentAccountProxy or CreditCardProxy or BankAccount.  
If more than one details are passed, only one detail used as per the following order, 1. PaymentAccountProxy 2. BankAccount 3. CreditCardProxy  
Preferred option is PaymentAccountProxy

EndFragment

get.summary: Fetch Customer payment options by customerReference
get.description:
PaymentOptions human readable form:

AutoPay: 22; EmailReminder: 23; SmsReminder: 24; FixedTerm: 25; BatchPay: 26; ScheduledPay: 27; OneOff: 28; PayID: 148; BPAY: 149

PaymentFrequency human readable form:

Weekly: 32; Fortnightly: 33; Monthly: 34; Quarterly: 35; HalfYearly: 36; Yearly: 37; FourWeeks: 38

NotificationMethod human readable form:

None: 0; Sms: 1; Email: 2

post.description:
### Important Notice for Using the Direct Card Payment Option:

This endpoint allows the submission of raw card details (`cardNumber`, `expiryMonth`, `expiryYear`, `cvv`) for processing payments. **However, this method requires a certain level of PCI DSS (Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard) compliance** to ensure the secure handling of sensitive card information. To enhance security and reduce the risks associated with directly managing card data, we strongly recommend using our **Payment Plugin jQuery** for secure card tokenization and payment processing.

**Please note:** This endpoint is restricted and can only be accessed once it has been enabled by Zenith Payments. Ensure you have the necessary permissions and configurations in place before attempting to use this method. For access or further assistance, please contact us at [integrations@zenithpayments.com.au](https://mailto:integrations@zenithpayments.com.au).
